subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New messages posted
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
They have made mentions of it over the years including a recent statement pertaining to the contact world which I just posted over on my esnips from last session. They said when the contact world first began it was very hard, and that access was terrible. Perhaps it is easier with some of the newer methods researchers are using to maintain contact. Franks box has opened up a new avenue for those who had a hard time hearing the traditional forms of evp. 

When I ask what the best method for contact is they always maintain its the method that no words are necessary. Or as one stated recently (also posted on esnips in water files) "I can telepathic, you just can't hear good telepathic" "it will always be tenuous". This coming after a few restless nights of being woken up to loud voices speaking to me or saying my name. Also a few things going on when I was wide awake and fully alert. 

I have also had some info come thru on "stations" and even one recording where voices I know seemed to jump from one group to another as I switched methods they could be heard introducing themselves to those surrounding them stating why they were barging in there to communicate. I find it all of interest tho it tends to be alot to wrap ones mind around.

Misty Dawn


--- On Sun, 9/21/08, Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:

> From: Ron Lederer <ronriko@...>
> Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New messages posted
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Sunday, September 21, 2008, 1:13 PM
> for Misty   Not a surprise here about ETs being
> involved.  From day one I have been sort of tracking what
> is reportedly said about "who is involved and who is in
> charge" of communications on the others side.  I hope
> more researchers ask the question so we can all compare
> notes.   For example, one evper report there are 10,000
> "communications stations" staffed on the other
> side.  My question are; staffed by who or what, what is
> their purpose, do they have regulations for what can be
> said to this side, and many, many more questions.  Like it
> has been said, if we knew all the answers this would not be
> research.  Hope to hear more on this from you and others. 
> Thanks for that....ron
>
